description:
Insight Global is seeking a Pricing Analyst to join a dynamic, high-performing team for our client in the Missile Defense Division. Your primary responsibility will be preparing and reviewing competitive cost and pricing submissions for government contracts, while shaping strategies that drive successful outcomes.

Responsibilities:
- Develop detailed cost and pricing volumes for government solicitations, ensuring timely delivery and adherence to client, organizational, and estimating system requirements.
- Guarantee that all cost proposals meet the standards outlined in the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR), Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement (DFARS), Cost Accounting Standards (CAS), and Truth in Negotiations Act (TINA).
- Partner with internal teams to support the development of Forward Pricing Rate Agreements (FPRAs) and ensure accurate application within proposals and pricing models.
- Work closely with program managers, technical experts, and functional departments to build and validate Basis of Estimates (BOEs) for labor, materials, subcontracts, and other direct costs.
- Establish and justify direct labor rates using internal payroll data and compensation structures as auditable sources.
- Utilize external benchmarks such as Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) data and salary surveys to confirm competitiveness and set rates for new positions.
- Develop and maintain advanced pricing models to analyze cost data, assess price reasonableness, and perform scenario-based analyses to refine pricing strategies.
- Ensure proposals fully comply with FAR, DFARS, and CAS, applying FPRA rates accurately to minimize compliance risks.
- Create and defend comprehensive BOEs for all cost components, particularly direct labor, leveraging both internal and external data sources.
- Build intuitive, robust pricing models that enable effective scenario planning and strategic decision-making.
- Cultivate strong partnerships with Program Management, technical teams, and Finance to deliver cohesive, well-supported proposals.

This position is onsite full-time in Colorado Springs, CO and this role will work standard working hours Monday-Friday. The salary range for this role is $80,000-$100,000/yr depending on years and level of experience, education, and certifications. This role requires an Active Secret Clearance or higher.

REQUIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
- 3+ years of general full time work experience
- 1+ years of experience in pricing, cost estimating, or financial anlaysist within the U.S. Government contracting industry, preferable within the DoD
- Experience developing cost proposals for various contract types (FFP, CPFF, CPAF, CPIF, T&M)
- Direct experience with the development, application, or negotiation of Forward Pricing Rate Agreements (FPRAs)
- Demonstrated understanding of government contracting regulations and rate structures, including FAR, DFARS, CAS, and Forward Pricing Rate Agreements (FPRAs).
- Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and SharePoint.
- Active DoD Secret Security Clearance
NICE TO HAVE SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
- Proficiency with various industry proposal management and pricing tools

This pivotal role involves the development of innovative power converters and power electronics-based equipment designs for HVDC transmission, DC grid architectures, and FACTS, ensuring optimal integration with the control and the broader power system. The successful candidate will report to the Valve Converter Electrical Team Leader and collaborate with the power electronics valves product manager and world-class experts within the HVDC converter valve team to deliver innovative converter valve products that positively impact the business.
The role gives an excellent opportunity for a motivated candidate to innovate, expand their design skill and personal development within a globally recognized expert team in HVDC and FACTS. The candidate will play a major role in technical decisions and design and innovation phases. It also involves internal interactions with other HVDC engineering functions and other businesses, but also external interactions with HVDC customers, 3rd party companies such as test laboratories, standard committees, universities and so on.
Responsibilities:
• Design, model, and analyze converter topologies (VSC, MMC) and components.
• Validate performance through simulations, prototyping, and testing.
• Develop requirement, design, and test specifications; ensure compliance with standards.
• Lead innovation in HVDC/FACTS products; document results via patents and publications.
• Mentor engineers; manage development activities and participate in design reviews.
• Support control and system design teams for integrated solutions.
• Develop sizing and design tools; ensure EMI compliance and robust converter design.
• Engage with customers, test labs, universities, and standard committees.

A client of Insight Global is seeking a Cybersecurity Penetration Tester to work 100% onsite at Aberdeen, MD in support of a defense program. Insight Global is seeking a Windows Systems Administrator based in Dahlgren, Virginia, to deliver technical assistance and provide solutions for common failures through customer support. This Windows Systems Administrator must have an active Secret Clearance, IAT Level 2 Certification, Security+, and a high school diploma. This role requires 4+ years' experience troubleshooting hardware, software, and other network related issues. Insight Global is seeking a skilled Technical Writer to work fully on-site in support of one of our large federal clients on a growing DoD contract. The ideal person would alleviate the discrepancies between sub-contractor and prime contractor deliverables as well as the perception of missing quality control functions being performed on deliverables before reaching the government. Job responsibilities would include, but are not limited to:
• Substantive/developmental editing: Evaluating the overall structure, flow, and completeness of documents to ensure it achieves its purpose for the target audience.
• Copy editing: Refining language for clarity, correcting specialized terminology, and ensuring strict adherence to style guides (i.e. IEEE, AP, or Army/DoW standards).
• Proofreading: A final quality check to catch minor errors in spelling, punctuation, and layout before publication.
• Technical verification: Cross-checking data, formulas, and diagrams against SME source material to prevent performance risks caused by incorrect or incomplete instructions.
• Software QA documentation: Editing of Test Plans, test cases, and Traceability Matrices to ensure requirements are testable and unambiguous (i.e. SMART).
• Developer documentation: Review of API documentation, SDK guides, and system architecture diagrams to ensure technical accuracy for the engineering or operator audience.

Compensation while on contract: $40/hr - $75/hr

DAY TO DAY: Our client is looking for experienced Security Officers to join their growing team! The Security Officer II role involves carrying out security tasks with professionalism and positivity, interacting with the public, patients, employees, and administrators. This role responds to various types of calls, offering help in both emergency and non-emergency situations. The officer investigates and records safety hazards, incidents, and criminal activities, both electronically and in writing. They patrol specified areas to ensure the safety of the public, patients, employees, and property. They are held accountable by the department's hierarchy for their initiative, judgment, and overall competence in performing tasks, responding to service calls, and carrying out everyday duties. They actively contribute to exceptional customer service and take responsibility for maintaining respectful relationships with everyone. The position necessitates successful completion and clearance from physiological and physical fitness screenings.

As a proactive security officer, you are assigned to specific areas where you perform critical tasks to maintain safety standards. Your duties include:

1. Patrolling and Vigilance:

* Regularly patrolling designated areas to ensure a visible security presence.

* Performing security-related tasks, such as checking doors and monitoring activity.

* Investigating any suspicious activity or individuals.

2. Reporting and Communication:

* Reporting hazards, unusual circumstances, or suspicious incidents to the Security Operations Center.

* Keeping your supervisor informed about any noteworthy activities or events.

* Responding promptly to varying levels of vulnerability, including life-threatening situations and natural disasters.

3. Emergency Response:

* Acknowledging and appropriately handling emergency, non-emergency, and alarm calls.

* Safely assessing alarm causes and providing assistance or direction as needed.

* Administering initial first aid based on your training level.

4. Fire Safety and Prevention:

* Responding to fire alarms during drills and actual incidents.

* Conducting helicopter fire prevention assessments and responding to helicopter fires.

* Maintaining effective communication with supervisors and fellow officers.

5. Conflict Resolution and Physical Management:

* De-escalating disputes between individuals using verbal techniques.

* Physically managing combative or violent persons when necessary (following annual aggression management training).

6. Enforcement and Assistance:

* Enforcing hospital rules and regulations within your assigned area.

* Assisting visitors with directions and information.

* Safely escorting people or property to desired destinations.

7. Investigation and Documentation:

* Interviewing and investigating individuals involved in suspicious or illegal activities.

* Documenting safety hazards, incidents, and criminal activities.

* Reporting findings to Security Administration and law enforcement.

8. Additional Duties:

* Participating in approved activities beyond security operations (e.g., morgue transport, fire extinguisher checks).

* Detaining unauthorized individuals as defined by policy or state law.

Conducting annual security assessments for individual hospital properties.

A global manufacturing company is seeking a Senior IT Capital Financial Management Analyst to join their enterprise IT organization. This role is responsible for end-to-end financial management of IT capital projects, with strong ownership of capital governance, SAP execution, financial analysis, and cross-functional coordination with global teams. The role manages IT hardware lifecycle projects, ensures compliance with capital guidelines, and drives accurate tracking, reporting, and closure of capital investments. The individual is expected to operate independently with minimal training and quickly take ownership of ongoing capital operations. This individual will go onsite 4 days/ week in Hyderabad and will be required to work 6:00 AM - 3:00 PM EST. This is an immediate need and is a 6-8 month contract to hire opportunity.
Key Responsibilities
· Submit and manage IT hardware lifecycle capital projects in EcoSys, ensuring accuracy and compliance with capital approval guidelines
· Submit WBS request codes in EcoSys and track approvals and readiness for project execution
· Create and maintain WBS / capital codes in SAP ERP for approved IT capital projects
· Review capital white papers and supporting documentation; coordinate clarifications and corrections with Project Managers (PMs)
· Review and validate DOA requirements and route items for appropriate approvals
· Ensure accurate cost tracking against approved budgets and project structures in SAP
· Maintain and update the IT Capital Tracker for project status, spend, milestones, and timelines
· Manage capital reporting and invoicing, ensuring alignment with actual project progress and capitalization rules
· Track purchase orders (POs) and capital commitments and ensure timely closure of POs and projects, including closure of open commitments, completion of asset documentation, and clearance of forecast variances
· As required, participate in regular PM sync calls to track milestones, risks, and dependencies and actively follow up to resolve financial or process issues
· Perform financial analysis to identify risks, variances, and control gaps and support corrective actions
· Ensure compliance with accounting standards, audit requirements, and internal financial controls
· Identify gaps and improvement opportunities in capital processes and support initiatives to simplify, standardize, and strengthen controls

Key Success Indicators
· Accurate and timely WBS creation and capital project setup
· Clean SAP capital structures and reliable financial reporting
· Timely closure of POs, commitments, and capital projects
· Minimal audit findings and financial exceptions
· Strong stakeholder satisfaction from IT, Finance, and Project Management teams

Our client seeks an excellent special education paraprofessional who is committed to raising student achievement through the integration of rigorous college preparatory classes with service to the community.

You are values aligned.

You are passionate about Salem Academy Charter School’s mission and vision.

You bring people together and build community.

You recognize the assets and community cultural wealth of all students, families, and staff.

You have experience fostering effective inclusion practices and a safe, positive, and respectful class and school culture.

Insight Global is seeking a highly motivated Research Physicist with a strong background in optics to conduct cutting-edge research in advanced optical materials, nonlinear optics and high-power laser physics to support a federal customer in Washington DC. A successful candidate will work as part of a collaborative team of scientist, inventing and innovating novel solutions to the most challenging problems facing naval science and technology. Their day to day will include but not be limited to:
• Contributing to the design, development, integration, test and evaluation of pulsed, state-of-the-art, solid-state, visible, near and mid-infrared High-Energy Laser (HEL) technology for government customers.
• Evaluating gain material, dopant identity and concentration, and heat spreading material for use in HELs, improved gain media mounting architecture through an iterative development procedure, using interferometry, far field beam quality and nearfield wavefront sensing to optimize the laser output.
• Designing, building and operating several vacuum chambers to support the development of HEL technology; vacuum systems built to explore ion beam polishing and material bonding, house lasers and house process monitoring systems as well as provide materials characterization.
• Developing and maintaining several home-built software tools for HEL development in Python and Matlab to analyze metrology data and to track system configuration, damage and performance.
• Studying extensively the reactivity of chemical warfare agents on surface-deposited, novel metal oxide cluster compositions for practical use in combat areas.

$60/hr to $69/hr.

Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.

Cyber Engineering supports patch management, intrusion prevention, intrusion detection,
consolidated log analysis, as well as perform analysis of infosec incidents.

• Work closely with Information Assurance to support enterprise data calls, Authorization to Operate (ATO) efforts and investigation of suspicious system behavior.
• Install, configure and maintain Splunk infrastructure including premium apps such as ITSI and SIEM.
• Install, configure and maintain network security devices such as IDS, IPS and related infrastructure.
• Create custom IPS signatures from IC reporting or from researching emerging threats on the internet to protect the program from emerging threats.
• Provide technical advice, guidance, and recommendations related to cyber topics impacting planning, systems and operations.
• Collect system and related logs as required by ITU and Enterprise policies, ensure ESOC access to log repositories.
• Establish vulnerability reporting criteria; monitor all vulnerability patch requirement (VPR) sites used for standard security incident tracking.
• Oversee and coordinate software and security patches and fix implementation in a timely manner.
• Coordinate patching with Information Assurance; ensure all necessary software patches, fixes and upgrades needed to comply with security policies and to address new vulnerabilities are applied.
• Investigate possible malicious attacks and follow the Security Incident Response plan when a possible cyber-attack takes place; brief management when an incident occurs and the steps taken to mitigate the security event.
• Perform vulnerability analysis and work with the system administrators to resolve the vulnerabilities or to develop a system corrective action plan.
• Perform analysis of malicious packets using Wireshark.
• Maintain awareness of real time threats, vulnerabilities and cyber incidents and their potential impact to program systems.
• Attend ITU and Enterprise cyber security meetings including, but not limited to, ITU POA&M and ESOC Security Briefing.
• Assess selected security controls based on the organization-defined continuous monitoring strategy; provide security status reporting to appropriate IT management.
• Assist with implementing NIST SP-800-37, Risk Management Framework for Information Systems and Organization.
• Coordinate IT Engineering related POAMs; perform Cyber Engineering related mitigations and responses as applicable.

Insight Global is seeking to hire a Pre-Deployment Manager to support a large federal contract sitting in Frederick, MD. As part of a Professional Services team, you will work efficiently alongside Consultants, Architects, Project Managers, and other internal & external interfaces to ensure that the customer succeeds in their objectives. This position requires excellent interpersonal skills, leadership skills, process improvement skills as well as configuration and implementation skills. As an Architect resource, you will be responsible for the translation of business requirements into specific process aligned designs for the Siemens DI Software solution-based on standard methodologies in the subject area. In this role, you will get along with the customer to support the management of customer expectations and support customer adoption by demonstrating the complete Siemens Delivery framework.



You will establish the technical integrity of the solution and ensure it remains aligned to requirements and value delivery throughout project to achieve customer value. Your leadership will also provide direction for process design, integration and change activities either internally or at customer sites and leverage relevant templates in the leadership of project solutions while also curating standard methodologies and templates. This role will primarily work under self-management and will determine solutions, methods and procedures on assignments/projects. Lastly, you will be asked to participate in the Architecture Community of Practice, promoting adoption within projects, and ensuring that knowledge and lessons learned are shared across project/program boundaries.



Responsibilities:



Understand and demonstrate how Siemens solutions will alter and integrate with customers' initiatives, business drivers, value and impact

Analyze and translate business requirements into an architectural blueprint that outlines solutions that integrate across applications, systems and platforms to achieve business objectives

Bring to bear industry standard methodologies and templates for the Siemens PLM Software solution delivered to provide customer value

Lead the application of Solution Definition and Solution Enablement elements DI Deployment Framework on projects

Provide accurate and timely information to project management team collaborating on reporting project status, issues, risks and benefits

Establish, build and maintain effective relationships with internal or external customers technical peers and build new relationships through networking within the customer and other involved parties to support effective delivery

Set and lead customers' expectations, demonstrating thought leadership to effectively influence key contacts and recommend solutions

In conjunction with the senior project leadership and account team, apply customer management methods to support successful adoption of a viable DI solution

Be responsible for validation activities, including any required prototyping, with the customer to verify if the outstanding templated solution applies to the customers' environment, rationalize and defend selected solution to the customer explaining why and how this solution will deliver the highest value to their business

Outline process changes that will need to occur and assist the customer drive Organizational Change.

Insight Global is looking for a System Administrator II specialized in Big IP F5, for a government contract. These individuals will be working on a military base doing all network and system support for all of the Air Force.

The day to day is as follows:
-Operate, maintain, monitor F5 appliances, configurations, identify BIG-IP Traffic Processing Objects, and analyze overall health and effectiveness of multiple Big IP F5 instances.
-Manage application integration designs around application logic and authentication configuration (session management, application redirects, rewrites, migration scenarios, app routing, CAC/PIV authentication).

Install, configure, and administer Big IP F5 Platform Suite referencing Web Applications with Local Traffic Manager (LTM) and Access Policy Manger (APM) services.
Install and patch Big IP F5 systems, and document DISA Security Technical Implementation Guidelines (STIGs) checklists.

-Create and maintain documentation detailing architecture components, configurations, monitoring & alerting setup, troubleshooting guides, and checklists.
-Notify appropriate Information Technical Equipment Custodian (ITEC) or Property Custodian (PC), in writing, within 4 hours for all accountable item moves.
-Neatly bundle and conceal all excess system or peripheral cabling after each installation or repair.

AFO has an opening for a dynamic Deputy Program Manager / Business Analyst (DPM) to support the Letterkenny Army Depot in Chambersburg PA.  As the DPM, you will directly support the program requirements for the Depot by achieving program objectives as you interface with customers and supervise a diverse team of technical professionals. Responsibilities include supporting the program manager’s daily operations relative to contract management, finance, security, staffing, supply chain, maintenance management, real property maintenance, life-cycle management and procurement.



The ideal candidate will have excellent team management skills, business process improvement skills, dynamic customer engagement and relationship management abilities.  Additionally, possess superior analytical and problem-solving skills, operate independently with limited supervision and feedback, be a strong team player, and can establish solid working relationships horizontally and vertically with staff members, peers, and our external Government customers.



The portfolio includes but is not limited to the following five areas: Maintenance Manufacturing Recapitalization (Recap) and Reset and Modernization and Technical Support; Weapon Systems Maintenance; Logistical Services in support of Production Management; Staffing Services in support of Logistics Modernization Program (LMP); and Real Property Management, maintenance, and support services.

Quickly respond to and resolve technical problems.

Support system upgrades and changes.

Share feedback to improve the system based on real-world use.

The Electro-Mechanical Assembly Technician is responsible for the production, integration, installation, and testing of electro-mechanical subassemblies and rack-based systems used in defense and industrial applications. This position involves hands-on mechanical and electrical assembly, cable routing, troubleshooting to component level, and system acceptance testing in accordance with engineering drawings, schematics, work instructions, and technical documentation. The technician ensures all equipment meets established quality and configuration standards and supports the development of installation and testing instructions for fielded systems.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities
• Assemble and integrate subassemblies into complete rack-based systems and enclosures.
• Perform mechanical assembly using hand tools, power tools, soldering equipment, and fixtures; align and secure components.
• Route and secure cables and harnesses inside electro-mechanical equipment racks in accordance with layout and configuration requirements.
• Test and repair subassemblies, cables, and components to board or device level; basic electronics troubleshooting required.
• Work from schematics, mechanical drawings, blueprints, written procedures, diagrams, and technical orders.
• Perform Acceptance Test Procedures (ATPs) using test equipment such as oscilloscopes, digital multimeters, and network test devices.
• Install hardware, cabling, and subassemblies and conduct final acceptance testing on completed rack systems.
• Prepare work records, test documentation, and configuration verification forms.
• Inspect parts, hardware, and assemblies for workmanship and surface defects.

Our customer is seeking a Superintendent to be the on-site field leader for Military Construction (MILCON) projects, responsible for managing all day-to-day jobsite operations and trades from horizontal development through vertical and interior finish. This role ensures safe, high-quality, and efficient field execution in accordance with MILCON code and safety requirements.

Key Responsibilities

Direct all daily jobsite operations, including oversight of subcontractors, field staff, equipment, deliveries, and sequencing.
Oversee all trade partners to ensure compliance with safety, sequencing, and workmanship standards.
Implement and maintain the site logistics plan developed by the Sr. CM, including access control, staging, material flow, and phasing.
Conduct daily field walks to verify progress, resolve issues, and ensure work adheres to approved drawings, submittals, specifications, and UFC/UFGS requirements.
Prepare and maintain 2-week lookahead schedules and coordinate updates with the Sr. CM for integration into the Integrated Master Schedule (IMS).
Coordinate with base personnel and government representatives on inspections, escorts, access, and field activities.
Enforce the Site-Specific Safety & Health Plan (SSHP) per EM 385-1-1; conduct daily safety briefings, inspections, and toolbox talks.
Enforce security compliance, including restricted-area access control and verification of personnel credentials.
Address safety deficiencies immediately and document corrective actions.
Support the Quality Control Manager (QCM) in implementing the USACE/NAVFAC Three-Phase QC Process (Preparatory, Initial, Follow-Up).
Verify that installed work meets UFC/UFGS criteria, contract documents, and approved submittals.
Track and document inspections, testing, material verification, and punch-list items.
Maintain red-line as-builts and coordinate updates with the Project Engineer.
Track daily progress, manpower, quantities, constraints, and delays; maintain accurate daily logs, photos, and reports per USACE/NAVFAC requirements.
Validate subcontractor progress quantities for billing and support Sr. CM with cost-to-complete updates.
Identify field issues impacting schedule, cost, or quality and escalate with recommended solutions.
Maintain Controlled Unclassified Information (CUI) compliance for all field documentation and communications.
Lead pre-task planning, daily coordination meetings, and subcontractor performance reviews.
Ensure proper integration of all scopes and coordinate with the Project Engineer for RFIs and design clarifications.
Assist with acceptance testing, mock-ups, and commissioning required by USACE/NAVFAC for new technologies.

description:

Prior leadership experience is not required—this role is ideal for an experienced technician who is ready to move into a working‑lead position while still remaining deeply hands-on. This position supports high‑fidelity F‑16 training devices used by the Air National Guard. The technician will work onsite at Hill AFB and collaborate closely with the site’s technical leadership structure. Candidates must be local to the Hill AFB area or willing to relocate. The technician will report to a remote lead technician, who reports to the program manager.

Leadership & Coordination
- Serve as a working lead for daily simulator operations and maintenance tasks.
- Assist with scheduling, workflow coordination, and ensuring coverage for operational hours.
- Provide input on contractor performance and support onboarding and training of new technical staff.
- Support a collaborative, safety-focused work environment aligned with base requirements.

Technical Operations

- Support daily readiness checks, startup/shutdown procedures, initialization, and Distributed Mission Operations (DMO) activities.
- Diagnose complex hardware, software, electronic, and network issues.

- Execute advanced diagnostics using electronic testing equipment and software tools.

The Senior Survivability Engineer leads efforts to ensure CUAS platforms remain resilient and operational in contested and evolving threat environments. This role involves defining protective technology requirements, coordinating with intelligence and OEMs, and safeguarding critical program information (CPI) through export controls and system assurance. The engineer conducts trade studies to evaluate radar, missile, and C2 system capabilities for enhanced survivability and security. They oversee system architecture to ensure it meets robust security and scalability standards, while managing technical risks across cost, schedule, and performance. Responsibilities include creating key documentation such as Program Protection Plans and Security Classification Guides, and ensuring compliance with system security best practices. The role requires deep technical expertise in system security engineering, protective technologies, and cyber resilience, along with strong leadership and communication skills. As a strategic partner to the PMO and other defense entities, the engineer influences program direction and supports threat assessments and system updates to improve survivability.

* Assist and drive development of comprehensive technical documentation, including installation guides, user manuals, and advanced troubleshooting procedures, to empower customers and internal stakeholders.

Install, maintain, troubleshoot, and optimize cyber and communication systems across large‑scale LAN/MAN architectures.
Ensure compliance with installation standards, technical orders, engineering drawings, and commercial specifications.

Insight Global is looking for a ColdFusion Developer to join one of their clients in New York City. This person will be responsible for, ensuring that the Law School’s legacy ColdFusion applications remain secure and functional as the university starts to get rid of LDAP authentication. Your primary focus will be on transitioning these systems to modern authentication methods, either by reworking ColdFusion modules to support SAML or by implementing a reverse application proxy that integrates with OAuth/SAML and enforces secure headers for authorization. This work will involve analyzing existing codebases, updating shared libraries, and validating that applications continue to operate reliably throughout the transition. Beyond authentication, you will manage critical infrastructure components such as Windows Server environments, load balancers, SSL certificate management, and multi-factor authentication. You will also contribute to ongoing migration efforts as applications are gradually moved to modern platforms like Salesforce, and .NET, while documenting workflows and providing support to ensure requirements are met. Day-to-day responsibilities will include balancing urgent short-term fixes with longer-term planning, participating in sprints using project management tools such as Linear, and applying CI/CD practices. You will also have to run daily/ every other day scrum calls to ensure alignment on the work being completed.

Insight Global is seeking a Simulation Systems Engineer to support a federal client part-time in Suffolk, VA. The Systems Engineer must have a strong Modeling and Simulation (M&S) background. This person will support the client with remote work and occasional visits to the customer’s Suffolk, VA Joint Staff Complex.

The successful candidate will provide direct support to the government customer, leveraging deep expertise in JLVC Federation M&S systems to create comprehensive MBSE models. You will be a key driver of innovation, using Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) and subject matter expertise to conceive and develop rapid M&S prototype solutions that further the modernization and standardization of JLVC training capabilities across the Department of War (DoW). This role requires a strategic thinker with a proven track record of architecting and integrating complex systems to solve critical warfighter challenges.

Essential Job Responsibilities

· Conduct in-depth research to create and maintain a comprehensive MBSE model of the JLVC Federation, defining its architecture, tracking testing, and enabling more rapid and reliable federation iterations.

· Lead efforts to capture, build, and track JLVC Modernization requirements, supporting the metrics team to ensure progress aligns with strategic goals.

· Collaborate with the JLVC Modernization engineering and development teams to design and conceive rapid prototypes of cutting-edge capabilities.

· Serve as a primary consultant on JSJ7 requirements for next generation wargaming tools, including the integration of the Army's NEXGEN Constructive (NGC) simulation capabilities.

· Support the requirements definition, development, and testing for the MAVEN Smart System JLVC data layer and the JTT application.

· Provide strategic consulting on the implementation of generative AI capabilities into training frameworks to accelerate work production and enhance collaboration.

· Travel quarterly to Suffolk, VA (if remote) and to M&S technology partner sites as required to facilitate collaboration and program success.

$59/hr to $62/hr.

Insight Global is seeking an Endpoint Policy Analyst, sitting hybrid in the Arlington, VA area. This individual will play a key role in the strategic oversight and execution of the Department of Defense’s Comply-to-Connect (C2C) Program—a Zero Trust-aligned framework that secures the DoD Information Network (DoDIN) by continuously verifying device posture before granting network access.

The candidate will assist in finalizing a comprehensive requirements matrix, maintain C2C guidance, and support outreach to DoD Components including DISA DCDC, Air Force, and Navy. They will engage with stakeholders at the Action Officer level, help map tool capabilities to implementation outcomes, and analyze C2C reporting to support quarterly program reviews and senior leadership briefings.

This role requires strong policy writing and briefing development skills, as well as technical familiarity with endpoint and network security concepts such as NAC, EDR, and device authentication. The candidate will collaborate with a team of three focused on endpoint security, and help transition responsibilities from oversight to execution as the program evolves. Responsibilities also include tracking tasks and deliverables across multiple workstreams, coordinating with vendors, and contributing to metric development and trend analysis based on data from DISA.

Compensation:
$50.00/hr to $57.00/hr.
